Package model.claire

Class WordChecker

java.lang.Object
model.claire.WordChecker
public class WordChecker
extends java.lang.Object
The WordChecker is used to verify that the tiles placed on the scrabble board gui by the player during their turn form one or more valid words according to the rules of Scrabble.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    WordChecker​(ScrabbleTrie trie, GameBoard board)
    This constructor creates a new WordChecker object connected to the specified ScrabbleTrie and the specified GameBoard.

  • Constructor Details

    • WordChecker

      public WordChecker​(ScrabbleTrie trie, GameBoard board)
      This constructor creates a new WordChecker object connected to the specified ScrabbleTrie and the specified GameBoard.
      Parameters:
      trie - The ScrabbleTrie that the WordChecker will use to validate the tiles placed on the gameboard and check that the tiles form a valid word.
      board - The game board that the WordChecker will use to check the tiles placed by the user.

  • Method Details

    • addTiles

      public void addTiles​(java.util.ArrayList<TilePlacement> tp)
      The addTiles method adds the specified TilePlacements to the WordChecker's internal list of TilePlacements to be checked for validity for the current turn. This method overwrites the current list of TilePlacements.
      Parameters:
      tp - The ArrayList of TilePlacements to add to the WordChecker.

    • validatePlacement

      public boolean validatePlacement()
      The validatePlacement() method validates the placement of the TilePlacements in the WordChecker's internal list of TilePlacements.
      Returns:
      The boolean value true if the tiles placed on the board are placed in a valid arrangement; the boolean value false if the tiles placed on the board are not placed in a valid arrangement.

    • addTilePlaced

      public void addTilePlaced​(TilePlacement tp)
      The addTilePlaced() method adds a single TilePlacement to the WordChecker's internal list of TilePlacements to be checked for validity for the current turn.
      Parameters:
      tp - The TilePlacement to add to teh WordChecker.

    • validateTiles

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<TilePlacement>> validateTiles()
      The validateTiles() method validates the tiles placed on the board during the current turn by validating the tiles in the WordChecker's internal list of TilePlacements.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of ArrayLists of TilePlacements representing the words formed on the board by the current turn's tiles, if any. The ArrayList returned from the method is empty if no words were formed on the board by the current turn's tiles.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      The reset() method resets the WordChecker in preparation for the next user's turn. It clears the list of TilePlacements (tilesPlaced) representing the Tiles placed on the board during the current turn, sets the valid field to false, and sets the current alignment to invalid.

    • readTilesFromBoard

      public void readTilesFromBoard()
      The readTilesFromBoard() method reads the current turn's tiles (as TilePlacements) from the game board. It fills the tilesPlaced ArrayList with the tiles (TilePlacements) placed during the current turn.

    • validatePlacement

      public boolean validatePlacement​(java.util.ArrayList<TilePlacement> tilesPlaced)
      The validatePlacement() method checks whether the Tiles placed on the board during the current turn are placed in a valid arrangement, i.e. in a straight line either horizontally or vertically. It does not check whether the tiles form a valid word on the board. The validatePlacement() method is intended to be called from the validateWord() method.
      Parameters:
      tilesPlaced - An ArrayList of TilePlacements representing the tiles placed on the board during the current turn and those tiles' positions on the board.
      Returns:
      The boolean value true if the tiles placed on the board during the current turn (the tilesPlaced parameter) are placed in a straight line, either horizontally or vertically, or if the user placed a single tile on the board. The boolean value false if the tiles placed on the board are not placed in a valid arrangement according to the Scrabble rules.

    • convertToString

      public static java.lang.String convertToString​(java.util.ArrayList<Tile> array)
      The convertToString() method is a utility method used to convert an ArrayList of Tile objects to a String.
      Parameters:
      array - the ArrayList of Tiles to convert.
      Returns:
      A String object containing the letters/chars within the Tile objects in the ArrayList.

    • convertTilePlacementsToString

      public static java.lang.String convertTilePlacementsToString​(java.util.ArrayList<TilePlacement> array)
      The convertToString() method is a utility method used to convert an ArrayList of TilePlacement objects to a String.
      Parameters:
      array - the ArrayList of TilePlacements to convert.
      Returns:
      A String object containing the letters/chars within the TilePlacement objects' Tiles in the ArrayList.

    • validateTiles

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<TilePlacement>> validateTiles​(java.util.ArrayList<TilePlacement> tilesPlaced)
      This method validates the tiles placed on the board during the current turn, and determines which words they form.
      Parameters:
      tilesPlaced - An ArrayList of ArrayLists of TilePlacements representing the tiles placed on the board during the current turn.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of ArrayLists of TilePlacements representing the words placed on the board during the current turn. This container is empty if no valid words were placed on the board during the current turn.

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      The getter method for the valid field. Should be called after the validateTiles() method.
      Returns:
      The boolean value true if the tiles placed on the board during the current turn form one or more valid words; false if the tiles do not form a valid word. Returns the value in the valid field.

    • getAlignment

      public java.lang.String getAlignment()
      The getter method for the alignment field. Should be called after validatePlacement() and/or validateTiles().
      Returns:
      A String describing the alignment of the tiles placed on the baord during the current turn. "horizontal" if the tiles are placed in a horizontal line "vertical" if the tiles are placed in a vertical line "single" if a single tile was placed on the board "invalid" if the tiles are not placed in a valid arrangement according to the rules of Scrabble.

    • validateTilesFirstTurn

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<TilePlacement>> validateTilesFirstTurn()
      This method validates the tiles placed on the board during the current turn; this version of validateTilesFirstTurn() must be called after readTilesFromBoard().
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of ArrayLists of TilePlacements representing the words placed on the board during the current turn, if any. This container is empty if no valid tiles were placed on the board during the current turn.

    • validateTilesFirstTurn

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<TilePlacement>> validateTilesFirstTurn​(java.util.ArrayList<TilePlacement> tilesPlaced)
      This method validates the tiles placed during the first turn of the game.
      Parameters:
      tilesPlaced - An ArrayList of TilePlacements that contains the tiles placed during the current turn and their positions on the board.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of ArrayLists of TilePlacements representing the words placed on the board during the current turn. This container is empty if no valid words were placed on the board during the current turn.
